page.title: 07West Shoreham
page.content: The Marlipins Museum was built in the 12th century and was re_built in the 14th century. The Community Centre in Pond Road caters for all ages and interests. Across the road is the Public Library where 10.000 ticket holders have access to 300.000 books. Adjoining the Library is the Health Centre where about 12 doctors hold their surgeries on a rota system. There are 5 churches in the town.They are St.Mary's, the oldest,dating from the 12th Century,Roman Catholic,the Huntingdon Free Church,Baptist and Methodist. The old railway gates are this year being replaced by modern barriers.The 2 signal boxes will have to be removed,and the crossing controlled by Lancing.
